INFO_EXPORT_DOCUMENTS: The system collects the documents associated with the responses of questionnaires corresponding to the selected years and questions. The system generates a ZIP file with the documents.
INFO_EXPORT_RESPUESTAS: The system collects the responses of all the questionnaires corresponding to the selected years. The system generates a file with the responses in CSV or Excel format.
INFO_DOWNLOAD_CERTIFICATES: The system collects the certificates of the questionnaires corresponding to the selected year. The system generates a ZIP file with the certificates.

PDF_CERTIFIES: Through this document, DIAMAS certifies that:
PDF_DATE: has completed a self-assessment to check to what extent its publishing services are in line with the Extensible Quality Standard in Institutional Publishing (EQSIP) for Diamond Open Access. Your answers suggest that
PDF_PARAP: of the required standards and desired advanced recommendations outlined in EQSIP.
PDF_PERCENTAGE: We thank you for your dedication to aligning with the best practices and standards formulated by DIAMAS. We hope that this self-assessment report will provide insights into the standards and practices of your publishing services and identify current good practices and potential improvements. We invite you to revisit the self-assessment tool at any time when you or your colleagues wish to reassess your publishing services.
PDF_NAME_QUESTIONNAIRE: institutional publishing service dedication to striving for excellence and aligning with the best practices set forth by DIAMAS.
PDF_RECOGNITION: If you have any questions or feedback, please email us at diamas@fecyt.es
PDF_PARAP3: institutional publishing service towards continuous improvement. May it serve as both recognition of your hard work thus far and as motivation to further elevate your standards.
PDF_GIVEN: Disclaimer: This self-assessment report is not meant as an evaluation tool to rank publishing services. The tool therefore should not be taken to represent any level of compliance with EQSIP, and it should not be taken to imply a ranking, or an implicit or explicit comparison with other publishing services. It is exclusively based on self-assessed information, it is exclusively available to you and based on the information that you have provided, and not based on any independently verified evidence. by.
PDF_SUCCESS_SUS: We hope that this self-assessment result will provide insights into the financial sustainability of your service. Feel free to use this to support you in your work.
PDF_PERCENTAGE_SUS: We invite you to revisit the self-assessment tool at any time when you or your colleagues wish to reassess your service.
PDF_RECOGNITION_SUS: Please note that this is the BETA version, so we appreciate any feedback you might give us to make this tool work better for you.
PDF_GIVEN_SUS: If you have any questions or feedback, please email us at selfassess@diamasproject.eu
TEXTO_EQSIP: The Extensible Quality Standard in Institutional Publishing (EQSIP) for Diamond Open Access is one of the main outputs of the DIAMAS project. EQSIP sets out standards for institutional publishing (IP) of scholarly journals in the broadest sense, with a special focus on those publishing models that do not charge fees to authors or readers. The objective of EQSIP is to set a common quality standard for IPs that publish scholarly journals.
TEXTO_EQSIP2: EQSIP must be seen as a measure of quality that IPs strive to meet. It represents an ideal quality level that serves as a point of reference against which IPs may be compared, and that they can hopefully conform to in good time and with appropriate support. This emphatically does not imply that IPs are expected to fully conform to this standard. To facilitate this, two levels of compliance have been differentiated. There are essential items to achieve EQSIP quality standard as well as desired items, i.e. advanced recommendations to improve its compliance even further.
TEXTO_EQSIP3: This Self-assessment tool allows IPs to privately check its degree of adherence with EQSIP standard to evaluate its strengths and weaknesses. Only the IPs themselves will have access to the assessment outcomes.
